name: Building Codes/Standards Applicable to All Constructions
description: Is there a National Building Code and/or a unified set of building standards applicable to all construction in the measured economy?

name: Legally adopted building design regulations
description: The country has a legally adopted building regulation than contains some design provisions.

name: Building code coverage: private buildings
description: The building code has some provisions related to the design and construction of private buildings in the country.

name: Building code coverage: public buildings
description: The building code has some provisions related to the design and construction of public buildings in the country.

name: Building code coverage: vernacular buildings
description: The building code has some provisions related to the design and construction of buildings using vernacular methods in the country.

name: Provisions for existing buildings: alterations or repairs
description: The building code has some proviions related to minor alterations and/or repairs for existing buildings.

name: Provisions for existing buildings: change of occupancy
description: The building code has some provisions for change of occupancy of existing buildings.

name: Provisions for existing buildings: additional floors or spaces
description: The building code has some provisions for building additions to existing buildings (additional floors or spaces).

name: Simplified design rules for small scale buildings (or “rules of thumb”)
description: Simplified provisions for certain types of small-scale buildings are permitted_x000D_by the code and these design rules are included in the building regulation document.

name: Countries with a building code integrating aspects related with structural strength (materials to be used, such as wood, concrete, tubular or masonry)
description: Please indicate whether the National Building Code and/or a unified set of building standards provide clear provisions or guidelines for each of the following: - 5. Structural strength (materials to be used, such as wood, concrete, tubular or masonry)

name: Countries with a building code integrating Soil testing requirements according to certain criteria (eg - based on classification, strength, compressibility of soil)
description: Please indicate whether the National Building Code and/or a unified set of building standards provide clear provisions or guidelines for each of the following: - 4. Soil testing requirements according to certain criteria (eg - based on classification, strength, compressibility of soil)

name: Wind actions
description: The building code contains some provisions related to wind loading actions.

name: Seismic actions
description: The building code contains some provisions related to seismic loading actions.

name: Structural design
description: The building code contains some provisions for structural design.

name: Geotechnical design
description: The building code contains some provisions for geotechnical design aspects.

name: Material requirements
description: The building code contains some provisions related to material specific requirements (e.g., minimum strength requirements and/or detailing of structural materials).

name: Provisions for construction materials: masonry (unreinforced)
description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of unreinforced masonry.

name: Provisions for construction materials: masonry (reinforced)
description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of reinforced masonry.

name: Provisions for construction materials: reinforced concrete (cast in place)
description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of cast in place reinforced concrete.

name: Provisions for construction materials: reinforced concrete (pre-cast)
description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of pre-cast concrete.

name: Provisions for construction materials: steel
description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of structural steel.

name: Provisions for construction materials: adobe or rammed earth
description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of adobe or rammed earth.

name: Provisions for construction materials: timber
description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of timber structures.

name: Mandated material testing for construction materials
description: The building code contains some provisions related to mandatory testing of construction materials.

name: Procedure to develop design wind loading
description: The code contains a procedure to determine wind loading, with at least some partial information required to perform wind design for a specific building (for example, a procedure which includes some elements todevelop the level of wind loads based on the location, exposure and soforth, and/or specifies type and level of design wind speeds for a site).

name: Country-specific wind- loading design criteria
description: The code contains country-specific wind design criteria for a site (for example, _x000D_country, region or city specific wind speed maps).

name: Simplified wind-loading design procedures
description: The effect of wind (suction or pressure) is simulated as static wind pressure _x000D_for the design of structural and nonstructural elements and their connections.

name: Wind importance factors
description: Importance of different buildings based on their occupancy/function (for _x000D_example, importance factor) is considered in the design for wind.

name: Wind design procedure for tall buildings
description: Dynamic effects of wind are considered in the design of tall buildings_x000D_ according to the code-prescribed procedure.

name: Wind design provisions for roof cladding and roof overhangs
description: Requirements to design roof cladding and roof overhangs to resist strong _x000D_winds. These could also include provisions related to roof shape.

name: Wind design of wall cladding and nonstructural appendages
description: Requirements to design nonstructural cladding and appendages (cladding,_x000D_ gutters, equipment, and so on) to resist strong winds.

name: Wind design of façade - wind bourne debris
description: Requirements to design façade to resist damage from wind- borne debris.

name: Wind design façade detailing - water ingress
description: Requirements to detail façade to resist water ingress during a strong wind event.

name: Detailing of doors and door mechanisms for strong winds
description: Requirements to detail doors and door mechanisms to resist strong winds.

name: Procedure for seismic design criteria
description: The code contains a procedure to determine seismic design parameters, with at least some partial information required to perform seismic design for a specific building (for example, a procedure that specifies some elements which may include the level of design seismic hazard for a specific site and/or a procedure to determine the design level of seismic base shear).

name: Country specific seismic criteria
description: The code contains country-specific seismic hazard parameters for design (for example, seismic hazard maps, seismic zonation maps or other seismic criteria parameters by site location or city, region, and so on).

name: Consideration of soil effects in seismic design criteria
description: Effect of soil conditions is considered in seismic analysis/design according to the code.

name: Seismic importance factors
description: The importance of different buildings in a post-earthquake situation is _x000D_considered based on their occupancy/function (for example, importance_x000D_ category).

name: Simplified seismic analysis procedures_x000D_ (for example, equivalent static)
description: A procedure to perform Equivalent Static Seismic Analysis is included in _x000D_the code.

name: Dynamic seismic analysis procedures_x000D_ (for example, response spectra,_x000D_ response time history analysis)
description: Procedures to perform dynamic analysis, for example, Response Spectra _x000D_(multimodal) analysis and/or response history analysis, are included in the_x000D_ code and are required in some cases.

name: Nonlinear static seismic analysis _x000D_procedures (for example, pushover)
description: A procedure to perform nonlinear static seismic analysis (pushover analysis)_x000D_ is included in the code.

name: Seismic ductility requirements and factors
description: Seismic force modification factors are prescribed for reinforced concrete and structural steel systems which are expected to be designed to perform at different ductility levels.

name: Seismic drift limits
description: Lateral displacement limits (for example, maximum inter-story displacement/drift) are prescribed for different buildings depending on their importance category.

name: Seismic design requirements related to building regularity (vertical and horizontal)
description: Provisions regarding  the seismic analysis/design of structures with horizontal (plan)_x000D_ and vertical (elevation) irregularities are included in the code.

name: Seismic design: diaphragm design
description: Some provisions for seismic design of floor diaphragms are included (for example, these could include diaphragm material specific provisions (concrete/steel/timber), design forces, diaphragm stiffness considerations, collector and connection forces, anchorage of walls).

name: Seismic design: advanced systems (base isolation, added damping systems, and so on)
description: Seismic analysis and design provisions for structures equipped with base isolation _x000D_devices and/or supplemental damping systems are included.

name: Seismic design: non structural components
description: Some provisions for seismic design of nonstructural components are included in the code (such as for the façade/building envelope; parapets; nonstructural/infill walls; mechanical, electrical, plumbing—MEP—equipment).

name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: concrete moment frames
description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of concrete moment frames - medium and/or high ductility (also called intermediate and/or special). For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: concrete shear wall
description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of concrete shear wall - medium and/or high ductility. For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: steel moment resisting frames
description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of steel moment resisting frames - medium and/or high ductility (also _x000D_called ordinary and/or special). For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: steel braced frame systems
description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of steel braced frame systems (concentric, eccentric and/or buckling_x000D_restrained brace frame). For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: confined masonry systems
description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of confined masonry systems. For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: timber lateral resisting systems
description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of timber lateral resisting systems (nailed plywood shear walls and/or_x000D_ other types). For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: masonry systems
description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of masonry systems. For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

name: Provisions for seismic assessment_x000D_ and retrofit of existing buildings
description: The code includes provisions related to seismic assessment and retrofit of_x000D_ existing buildings.

name: Load procedure for flood loading
description: Provisions for determining loading from flooding, and/or storm surge.

name: Design for flooding: higher level evacuation areas
description: Requirements for higher level evacuation areas for building occupants (for _x000D_example roof access, balconies) in case of a flood event.

name: Limitations on occupied zones below the design flood level
description: Provisions that limit or prohibit occupied zones below the design flood_x000D_ level.

name: Design for flooding: critical equipment and services
description: Requirements to locate critical equipment and/or services above design_x000D_ flood level.

name: Design for flooding: structural and nonstructural materials
description: Provisions related to structural and nonstructural material requirements in_x000D_ relation to flooding.

name: Design for flooding: vents, valves or other wall openings
description: Requirements for the design of vents, valves or other openings in the walls _x000D_of enclosed spaces below the design flood level to equalize lateral water_x000D_ pressures.

name: Site investigation
description: The codes includes provisions for performing geotechnical site investigations and, in some cases, the code requires site investigation to be carried out.

name: Design of foundations
description: Some provisions of the code relate to the design of foundations for buildings (including how to develop foundation design parameters based on soil type, soil data, and so on).

name: Design of retaining walls
description: Some provisions relate to the design of retaining walls for buildings (including how to develop retaining wall design parameters based on soil type, soil data,and so on).

name: Dead and live loading
description: Provisions for determining dead loads and minimum live loads are included in the code.

name: Load combinations
description: The building regulation document contains load combinations for all applicable loads and materials that are covered within the document.

name: Provisions for construction materials: reinforced concrete
description: Some structural design provisions are in place for reinforced concrete.

name: Provisions for construction materials: pre-cast concrete
description: Some structural design provisions are in place for pre-cast concrete.

name: Provisions for construction materials: structural steel
description: Some structural design provisions are in place for structural steel.

name: Provisions for construction materials: reinforced masonry and/or reinforced grouted hollow block masonry
description: Some structural design provisions are in place for reinforced masonry and/or reinforced grouted hollow block masonry.

name: Provisions for construction materials: confined masonry
description: Some structural design provisions are in place for confined masonry.

name: Provisions for construction materials: unreinforced masonry (hollow block and/or brick and/or stone)
description: Some structural design provisions are in place for unreinforced masonry (hollow block and/or brick and/or stone).

name: Provisions for construction materials: timber
description: Some structural design provisions are in place for timber.

name: Provisions for construction materials: earth (including adobe, soil stabilized block, rammed earth, and so on)
description: Some structural design provisions are in place for earth (including adobe, soil stabilized block, rammed earth, and so on)

name: Provisions for construction materials: bamboo
description: Some structural design provisions are in place for bamboo.

name: Minimum material requirements for concrete and reinforcing bars
description: The code specifies minimum structural material requirements for reinforced concrete (minimum compressive strength, minimum strength and ductility requirements for reinforcing steel).

name: Structural requirements for additions (extensions)
description: The code includes some provisions related to structural considerations (including seismic design where applicable) for horizontal and/or vertical building extensions (this may include addressing incremental construction practices).

name: Structural requirements for change of occupancy/use
description: The code includes some provisions that would prompt consideration of the existing structural system capacity (including seismic design where applicable) when a change of use or occupancy is made.

name: Structural assessment
description: The code includes provisions related to assessment of the structural condition of existing buildings.

name: Provisions for retrofit (including structural changes)
description: The code contains some provisions related to building retrofit, including provisions related to structural design of retrofits.

name: Countries with natural disaster resistant construction related standards
description: Please indicate whether the National Building Code and/or a unified set of building standards provide clear provisions or guidelines for each of the following: - 1. Natural disaster resistant construction (e.g., floods, storms, earthquakes, etc.)

name: Flood mitigation
description: The building code contains some provisions related to flood mitigation.

name: Landslides
description: The building code contains some provisions related to landslides.

name: Countries with a building code integrating building classification according to certain criteria (e.g., usage; size)
description: Please indicate whether the National Building Code and/or a unified set of building standards provide clear provisions or guidelines for each of the following: - 2. Building classification according to certain criteria (e.g., usage; size)

name: Use and occupancy classifications
description: The building code contains some provisions related to use and occupancy classifications.

name: Height and areas limitations based on the type of construction
description: The building code contains some provisions related to height and areas limitations based on the type of construction.

name: Special considerations for certain building types
description: The building code contains some provisions related to special design considerations for certain building types.

name: Importance or risk classification of buildings
description: The code contains importance and/or risk classification of buildings (sometimesalso called consequence classes).

name: Countries with a building code integrating active and passive fire safety measures
description: Please indicate whether the National Building Code and/or a unified set of building standards provide clear provisions or guidelines for each of the following: - 3. Active and passive fire safety measures

name: Fire resistance performance requirements
description: The building code has some provisions related to fire resistance performance requirements.

name: Means of access and egress
description: The building code has some provisions related to means of egress and access in case of fire.

name: Fire prevention
description: The building code has some provisions related to fire prevention.

name: Fire service access
description: The building code has some provisions related to fire service access.

name: Fire resistance of structural elements
description: Some provisions related to fire resistance of the main structural elements are included in the code.

name: Accessibility and inclusivity standard applicable to all construction
Access route and means
description: The building code has some provisions related to access routes and means for people of all ages and abilities.

name: Fixtures and signals
description: The building code has some provisions related to design of fixtures and signals for people of all ages and abilities.

name: Accessibility and usability of internal facilities
description: The building code has some provisions related to accessibility and usability of internal facilities for people of all ages and abilities.

name: External environment
description: External environment (for example, approach to building entrance, circulation routes, and so on). The regulation document contains some provisions on universal accessibility requirements related to the external environment.

name: Entrances, doors, and lobbies
description: The regulation document contains some provisions related to universal_x000D_ accessibility requirements for entrances, doors and/or lobbies.

name: Horizontal and vertical circulation within a building
description: The regulation document contains some provisions related to universal_x000D_ accessibility requirements for horizontal and vertical circulation.

name: Building facilities
description: The regulation document contains some provisions related to universal_x000D_ accessibility requirements for building facilities, including WC/toilets.

name: Building fixtures and fittings to assist_x000D_ with orientation, wayfinding, and_x000D_ communication
description: The regulation document contains some provisions related to universal_x000D_ accessibility requirements for building fixtures and fittings.

name: Evacuation and safe egress
description: The regulation document contains some provisions related to universal_x000D_ accessibility requirements for evacuation and safe egress.

name: Are there legally required minimum energy efficiency performance standards in the building code or any other building regulations?
description: Are there legally required minimum energy efficiency performance standards in the building code or any other building regulations?

name: Is proof of compliance with energy efficiency standards included as a precondition for obtaining a building permit?
description: Is proof of compliance with energy efficiency standards included as a precondition for obtaining a building permit?

name: Thermal transmittance or insulation calculations for building envelopes are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 1. Thermal transmittance or insulation calculations for building envelopes

name: Solar heat gain calculations for building envelope are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 2. Solar heat gain calculations for building envelope

name: Glazing factors for fenestration are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 3. Glazing factors for fenestration

name: Heating/cooling demand calculations are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 4. Heating/cooling demand calculations

name: Daylighting and orientation are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 5. Daylighting and orientation

name: Permanent shading are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 6. Permanent shading

name: Air barrier, air leakage or air infiltration are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 7. Air barrier, air leakage or air infiltration

name: Required minimum efficiency of heating and cooling equipment and controls standards are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 8. Efficiency of heating and cooling equipment and controls

name: Required minimum standards for efficiency of water heating equipment and controls are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 9. Efficiency of water heating equipment and controls

name: Efficiency of lighting fixtures and controls are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 10. Efficiency of lighting fixtures and controls

name: Are there any incentives provided to builders in order to promote green building standards?
description: Are there any incentives provided to builders in order to promote green building standards?

name: Natural Insulation and ventilation
description: The building code contains some provisions related to natural insulation and ventilation.

name: Green building construction material
description: The building code contains some provisions related to construction materials which are more sustainable and meet green building requirements.

name: Energy and water efficient design methods
description: The building code contains some provisions related to energy and water efficient design requirements.

name: Carbon smart/neutral construction
description: The building code contains some provisions related to carbon smart/neutral construction.

name: Building orientation
description: Orientating the building to optimize the level of direct heat from sunlight entering the building. The regulation includes some voluntary provisions on building orientation to_x000D_ control solar heat gain and/or improve natural ventilation.

name: Daylighting
description: The regulation includes some voluntary provisions on building orientation to control solar heat gain and/or improve natural ventilation. The regulation document specifies voluntary or mandatory provisions related _x000D_to daylighting (for example, that a certain percentage of habitable building_x000D_ area must be adequately lit through daylight).

name: Natural ventilation
description: Natural ventilation to provide fresh air indoors and support cooling. The regulation document contains provisions which require a certain amount of operable window, glazing, or perforation area with respect to the room’s usable floor area.

name: Solar shading
description: External solar shading to control solar heat gain. The regulation document provides guidance on various types of shading_x000D_ elements and related design provisions (voluntary or mandatory).

name: Insulation of walls, roofs and windows _x000D_(U-value requirements)
description: Insulation of walls, roofs and windows to stop over-heating in hot weather and heat loss in cold weather. The regulation documents specify mandatory U-value requirements for the_x000D_ walls, roofs and/or window assemblies.

name: Window-to-Wall Ratio (WWR)
description: Window-to-Wall Ratio (WWR) requirements to balance the need for light and ventilation with the amount of solar heat gain from glazed areas. The regulation documents have mandatory provisions related to WWRs (and_x000D_provide a formula to calculate WWR). These can include requirements for _x000D_minimum or maximum WWR and/or different WWRs for differently oriented_x000D_ walls.

name: Reflective walls and roofs
description: Reflective walls and roofs to reduce solar heat gain. The regulations specify mandatory solar reflectance index (SRI) values for_x000D_ walls and/or roofs.

name: Green walls and roofs
description: Green walls or roofs to cool buildings both externally and internally. The regulations document addresses their design and construction. If the provisions are mandatory, they may include minimum standard for such roofs and walls in terms of area covered by vegetation.

name: Energy efficient lighting
description: Energy efficient lighting (for example, LEDs, light sensors, and so on). The regulation document specifies light power density for various types of_x000D_buildings and/or a minimum level of lumens per watt for lighting fixtures _x000D_and/or requirements for sensors such as daylight sensors and/or occupancy_x000D_ sensors to control the use of lighting depending on user needs.

name: Energy-efficient Heating Ventilation_x000D_ and Air Conditioning (HVAC) systems
description: Energy-efficient heating ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) mechanical systems. The regulation document contains some mandatory provisions related to measures to improve energy efficiency of HVAC systems and other equipment. These could include requirements for pipe and duct insulation, ceiling fans, air economizers, setting a minimum coefficient of performance for air conditioning and/or heating equipment, heat recovery from return air and/or requirements for variable frequency drives.

name: Renewable energy
description: Renewable methods to supply the building with energy (for example, solar panels, geothermal). The regulation document includes some provisions related to onsite generation of electricity through solar power or wind and/or connection to a grid that provides off-site renewable energy (voluntary or mandatory).

name: Water-efficient fixtures and fittings
description: Water-efficient fixtures and fittings (for example, low-flow toilets, taps, and so on). The regulation document includes mandatory provisions related to water-efficient fixtures and fittings. For example, it may specify flow rates by type of fixture or fitting (for example, faucets, showers, toilets).

name: Water collection/water re-use
description: Water collection/water re-use (for example, rainwater harvesting, use of grey water for certain functions). The regulation document includes some voluntary or mandatory provisions_x000D_for this (for example, condensate recovery, rainwater harvesting, re-use of_x000D_ treated water for potable and nonpotable uses).

name: Recycled building materials
description: Recycled building materials (for example, requirements for a building to use recycled materials and/or be recyclable). The regulation document specifies a mandatory percentage of building materials to be made of recycled materials.

name: Low embodied energy materials
description: Low embodied energy materials (for example, materials with lower carbon footprints). The regulation document encourages or prescribes the use of low embodied energy materials and/or gives guidance on how to calculate the carbon footprint of the building materials and optimize building material used to reduce the carbon footprint.

name: Plumbing and sanitary systems
description: The buildiing code contains some provisions related to plumbing and sanitary systems.

name: Electrical systems
description: The buildiing code contains some provisions related to electrical systems.

name: Elevators, escalators, and lifts
description: The buildiing code contains some provisions related to elevators, escalators and lifts.

name: Heating, ventilating, and air conditioning
description: The buildiing code contains some provisions related to heating, ventilating, and air conditioning systems.

name: Does the regulatory framework require permits for the handling, removal, and disposal of regulated construction materials that pose health risks?
description: Does the regulatory framework require permits for the handling, removal, and disposal of regulated construction materials that pose health risks?

name: Asbestos are regulated
description: Which of the below materials are regulated? - 1. Asbestos

name: Lead-containing pipes, components, paints are required to be inspected/tested by law are regulated
description: Which of the below materials are regulated? - 2. Lead-containing pipes, components, paints

name: Mercury-containing fluorescent lamps, thermostats, and electric devices are regulated
description: Which of the below materials are regulated? - 3. Mercury-containing fluorescent lamps, thermostats, and electric devices

name: Polychlorinated biphenyls in electric transformers, fluorescent light ballasts, caulk, and masonry joints are regulated
description: Which of the below materials are regulated? - 4. Polychlorinated biphenyls in electric transformers, fluorescent light ballasts, caulk, and masonry joints

name: Asbestos are required to be inspected/tested by law

description: Which materials are required to be inspected/tested by law? - 2. Lead-containing pipes, components, paints

description: Which materials are required to be inspected/tested by law? - 3. Mercury-containing fluorescent lamps, thermostats, and electric devices

name: Polychlorinated biphenyls in electric transformers, fluorescent light ballasts, caulk, and masonry joints are required to be inspected/tested by law
description: Which materials are required to be inspected/tested by law? - 4. Polychlorinated biphenyls in electric transformers, fluorescent light ballasts, caulk, and masonry joints

name: Countries with a map that identify areas allocated to residential, commercial, agricultural, recreational, public/institutional, mixed use

description: Are any of the following planning tools mandatory requirements prior to the formal development of land? - 3. Hazard maps that identify areas in which building is not permitted due to natural hazards

name: Countries with hazard maps that identify minimum separation between residential and hazardous occupancies
description: Are any of the following planning tools mandatory requirements prior to the formal development of land? - 4. Hazard maps that identify minimum separation between residential and hazardous occupancies

name: Countries with requirements for trunk infrastructure service access (water, electricity, sanitation)

name: Countries with maps that identify areas in which building is not permitted in relation to natural resources

name: Having a minimum number of years of practical experience is legally required to conduct technical supervisions/inspections of construction projects?
description: What type of qualification is legally required to conduct technical supervisions/inspections of construction projects? - 2. Having a minimum number of years of practical experience

name: Being a registered member of the order (association) of architects or civil engineers  is legally required to conduct technical supervisions/inspections of construction projects?
description: What type of qualification is legally required to conduct technical supervisions/inspections of construction projects? - 3. Being a registered member of the order (association) of architects or civil engineers

name: Having to pass a qualification examis legally required to conduct technical supervisions/inspections of construction projects?
description: What type of qualification is legally required to conduct technical supervisions/inspections of construction projects? - 4. Having to pass a qualification exam

name: Professional_x000D_ certification and_x000D_ registration system
description: The country has a professional certification and registration mechanism including a clear and mandatory registration system for all professionals in the construction industry and a classification and qualification system exists for contractors.

name: Being an accredited architect or engineer is legally required to conduct technical supervisions/inspections of construction projects?
description: What type of qualification is legally required to conduct technical supervisions/inspections of construction projects? - 1. Being an accredited architect or engineer

description: Are there clear defined steps to modifying the zoning/land use plan in the measured city?

name: Are technical inspections for structural safety (if any) required by law to be carried out during construction?
description: What types of technical inspections for structural safety (if any) are required by law to be carried out during construction? - 1. None

name: Are random/unscheduled inspections required by law to be carried out during construction?
description: What types of technical inspections for structural safety (if any) are required by law to be carried out during construction? - 2. Random/unscheduled inspections

name: Are Phased inspections required by law to be carried out during construction?
description: What types of technical inspections for structural safety (if any) are required by law to be carried out during construction? - 3. Phased inspections

name: Are Risk-based type inspections required by law to be carried out during construction?
description: What types of technical inspections for structural safety (if any) are required by law to be carried out during construction? - 4. Risk-based type inspections

name: According to the law, is the public agency (i.e., technical department of the municipality) responsible for verifying compliance of building plans with existing building regulations?
description: According to the law, who is responsible for verifying compliance of building plans with existing building regulations? - 1. Public agency (i.e., technical department of the municipality)

name: According to the law, is a private and external firms of certified architects and/or civil engineers (third party professionals to be hired by the builder) responsible for verifying compliance of building plans with existing building regulations?

name: Established building control processes
description: The building control processes are clearly defined in any regulations or government documents with a complete_x000D_ and detailed framework_x000D_ defining the building_x000D_ control processes.

name: Optimized process
description: The building control process integrates a tiered system of building categories to determine application requirements and allocate human resources. There is a clear categorization system within the building control regulations that introduces clearly differentiated requirements and processes for different categories of buildings based on parameters such as height, total size, and so forth.

name: Defined building _x000D_inspection _x000D_framework
description: The building control framework integrates inspections by the authority in charge during the construction process. In particular, regulations have defined a clear inspections framework, setting out who is in charge of site visits and when, with responsibilities clearly stated.

name: An online approval system is available in the country

name: Independent dispute resolution mechanism

name: Dispute resolution _x000D_mechanism
